medical_history.chief_complaint: Irregular vaginal bleeding lasting for 5 months.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a 5-month history of irregular vaginal bleeding, which began three months prior when a cervicovaginal smear was reported as adenocarcinoma. Symptoms progressed but subsequent cervical and endometrial biopsies showed only inflammatory changes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient had previously diagnosed Peutz-Jeghers syndrome (PJS) and a small bowel segmental resection at age 14 for bleeding adenomatous polyps, later determined to be hamartomatous.
medical_history.family_history: Three of her four teenage children exhibited prominent perioral hyperpigmentation and had undergone abdominal surgery for complications related to small intestinal hamartomatous polyps.
